qas.question: Which book supposedly caused Augustus' sister to faint?
What was the title of Jean-Baptiste Wicar's artwork inspired by the Aeneid?
Who did Virgil recite Books 2, 4, and 6 of the Aeneid to?
How many paintings did Jean-Baptiste Wicar base on Virgil's life?
Did critics call the painting "Virgil Reading the Aeneid" a great success or a failure?
How many poems did Augustus commission from Virgil?
What was the name of a scholar that doubted claims that Augustus' sister fainted when Virgil recited the Aeneid?
What book of the Aeneid is the longest?

context: The Aeneid appears to have been <b4_0>a great success<b4_0/>. Virgil is said to have recited Books <b7_0>2<b7_0/>, <b3_0>4<b3_0/>, and 6 to <a2_0>Augustus<a2_0/>; and Book <a0_0><b5_0>6<b5_0/><a0_0/> apparently caused Augustus' sister Octavia to faint. Although the truth of this claim is subject to scholarly scepticism, it has served as a basis for later art, such as <b6_0>Jean-Baptiste Wicar<b6_0/>'s <a1_0>Virgil Reading the Aeneid<a1_0/>.
